result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter W Buchert was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Extradition costs in the amount of $2010.40 to be paid to the DA's office.  Bail to be applied to extradition costs only.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.
  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for
Oconomowoc Police Department to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Defendant Peter W Buchert in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed outright.  14CF1330 is dismissed and read into this case.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #2. 

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of 
4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 54 days )
2 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years, may be transferred out of state.
May have early termination from probation after 2 1/2 years if approved by agent. 
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
AODA Assessment and follow through
Condition Time: 12 months Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.  
Extradition cost: $2010.40 to be paid to the DA's office; Bail to be applied to the extradition costs only.  Remainder of the bail to be refunded to the poster. 
FINE:  $2248.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Oconomowoc Police Department.
DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.
